isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING PUMP: VICKERS (LUK) V10NF AND V20NF - LUBRICATION/BLEED SYSTEM

svcsubsecinfo.para: Internal lubrication is provided by the system fluid. For lubrication requirements and intervals, refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

Periodic inspection of the fluid condition and piping should be done in accordance with the schedules outlined in the GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION section of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. The following should be checked on a regular schedule.

item.para: All hydraulic connections must be kept tight. Loose connections will result in fluid loss. Loose suction or return lines draw air into the system, resulting in noisy and/or erratic operation.

Check the reservoir at regular intervals for dirt or other contaminants. If the fluid becomes contaminated, the system must be thoroughly cleaned (including the reservoir), and refilled with new fluid.

Filters must be checked and/or replaced regularly. A clogged filter results in a higher pressure drop that forces particles through the filter that would otherwise be trapped. A clogged filter may cause the fluid to bypass the filter entirely and result in a complete loss of filtration.
A pump running excessively hot or noisy is a potential failure. The vehicle should be shut down immediately and the problem corrected.

caution.para: If fluid levels become so low as to uncover the inlet pipe opening in the reservoir, extensive damage to the pump can occur.

svcproc.title: ADDING FLUID TO THE SYSTEM
svcproc.para: When adding hydraulic fluid to the system always pour through a fine wire screen (200 mesh or finer). It is important that the fluid is clean and free of any contaminants that could cause improper operation or damage to the pump or other system components.

caution.para: Do not use cloth or similar substance to strain the hydraulic fluid as lint may get into the system and cause damage to the vehicle.
